title: Roland Avery
text:
Roland "Roly" Dreadon Avery (15 June 1927 – 21 May 2015) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> referee.
Referee career.
Avery controlled his first two international test matches during <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a>'s 1949 tour of New Zealand. He went on to referee another three test matches involving Australia, one in 1953 and two in 1961, and two involving <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, during their 1962 tour of New Zealand. As well as seven test matches, Avery also controlled a match between France and South Auckland during the <a href="1951%20French%20rugby%20league%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1951 French tour of New Zealand</a>.
Avery died in <a href="Huntly%2C%20New%20Zealand">Huntly</a> on 21 May 2015, aged 87.
